dt: {bc}the portion of the vertebrate central nervous system enclosed in the skull and continuous with the spinal cord through the foramen magnum that is composed of neurons and supporting and nutritive structures (such as glia) and that integrates sensory information from inside and outside the body in controlling autonomic function (such as heartbeat and respiration), in coordinating and directing correlated motor responses, and in the process of learning {dx}compare {dxt|forebrain||}, {dxt|hindbrain||}, {dxt|midbrain||}{/dx}
{bc}a nervous center in invertebrates comparable in position and function to the vertebrate brain
{bc}something that performs the functions of a brain
{bc}an automatic device (such as a computer) for control or computation

art.capt: brain 1a: {it}1{/it} cerebral hemisphere, {it}2{/it} corpus callosum, {it}3{/it} ventricle, {it}4{/it} fornix, {it}5{/it} thalamus, {it}6{/it} pituitary gland, {it}7{/it} pons, {it}8{/it} medulla oblongata, {it}9{/it} spinal cord, {it}10{/it} cerebellum, {it}11{/it} midbrain

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}brægen{/it}; akin to Middle Low German {it}bregen{/it} brain, and perhaps to Greek {it}brechmos{/it} front part of the head
shortdef: the portion of the vertebrate central nervous system enclosed in the skull and continuous with the spinal cord through the foramen magnum that is composed of neurons and supporting and nutritive structures (such as glia) and that integrates sensory information from inside and outside the body in controlling autonomic function (such as heartbeat and respiration), in coordinating and directing correlated motor responses, and in the process of learning
a nervous center in invertebrates comparable in position and function to the vertebrate brain
to kill by smashing the skull

dt: {bc}a massive reef-building coral (such as genus {it}Diploria{/it}) having the surface covered by ridges and furrows

shortdef: a massive reef-building coral (such as genus Diploria) having the surface covered by ridges and furrows

dt: {bc}a mental lapse caused especially by carelessness, forgetfulness, or inattention

shortdef: a mental lapse caused especially by carelessness, forgetfulness, or inattention —called also brain fart

dt: {bc}final cessation of activity in the central nervous system especially as indicated by a flat electroencephalogram for a predetermined length of time

shortdef: final cessation of activity in the central nervous system especially as indicated by a flat electroencephalogram for a predetermined length of time

dt: {bc}the departure of educated or professional people from one country, economic sector, or field for another usually for better pay or living conditions

shortdef: the departure of educated or professional people from one country, economic sector, or field for another usually for better pay or living conditions

dt: {bc}the act or an instance of comprehensively and uncritically expressing and recording one's thoughts and ideas (as on a particular topic)

dt.t: Instead, Shafer recommends doing a {wi}brain dump{/wi}—getting workflow, ideas, commitments, and to-do lists out of your head and onto a physical list and calendar.
First, you do a giant {wi}brain dump{/wi} to force yourself to clear out the mental clutter and face head-on all the contradictory goals and obligations that are crowding your days.

shortdef: the act or an instance of comprehensively and uncritically expressing and recording one's thoughts and ideas (as on a particular topic)

dt: {bc}a usually temporary state of diminished mental capacity marked by inability to concentrate or to think or reason clearly

shortdef: a usually temporary state of diminished mental capacity marked by inability to concentrate or to think or reason clearly
